New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest player to ever score at the UEFA European Championship finals at the age of 38 years and 289 days.
Mattia Zaccagni scored the ninth goal in second-half added time at Euro 2024, equalling the highest tally seen at a European Championship tournament.
Key Match Events: Luka Modric missed a penalty in the 52nd minute, but scored a goal just 33 seconds later.
Mattia Zaccagni scored a dramatic equalizer in the 98th minute to send Italy through to the last 16.
Pre-Game Insights: Italy finished second in Group B to qualify for the last 16 of Euro 2024.
Croatia needed to win this match to make it through to the knockout stages.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric's goal might have spelled the end of his international career.
Italy will face Switzerland in Berlin on 29 June, while Croatia have a nervous wait to see if they can reach the knockout stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first half of the encounter was tight, cautious and dare we say… dull.
There was just 33 seconds between Luka Modric’s saved penalty and his opening goal.
Others: The Opta supercomputer doesn’t give Croatia much hope of reaching the last 16, projecting a spot in just 2.7% of simulations.
Italy ended a run of 281 minutes without a Euros goal with Zaccagni’s goal.
